title: Split and Join
content:
## Split and Join

Split and Join are opposites, split is used in strings and Join is used in arrays.


### Split 
Transforms a string into an array

```js 
// Source String
const alphabet = "abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz"
// Split returns an array from a string
splitAlphabet = alphabet.split("")
// Print the array
console.log(splitAlphabet)

[
  'a', 'b', 'c', 'd', 'e', 'f',
  'g', 'h', 'i', 'j', 'k', 'l',
  'm', 'n', 'o', 'p', 'q', 'r',
  's', 't', 'u', 'v', 'w', 'x',
  'y', 'z'
]
```

### Join

Transforms an array into a string
```js 
// Source Array
splitAlphabet
// Join Returns a string
joinedString = splitAlphabet.join("")
// Print the String
console.log(joinedString)
"abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz"
```
